Sabrina changed into some workout clothes, threw her shirt and sweatpants into a bag, and drove to the gym, arriving well before Ben did, and decided that she would work out while she waited for him. She wasn’t terribly interested in having big muscles, but she did like to run on the treadmill. She also liked playing basketball, and she wasn’t afraid of lifting weights every now and then.

Wait, no, that wasn’t right. Sabrina never used the treadmill. She liked to jog outside. Jogging... and volleyball... and yoga. Those were things she remembered doing, but for some reason, she didn’t want to do those things anymore. Now she wanted to use the treadmill, play basketball, and lift weights.

Finally, Ben arrived. He was wearing a muscle shirt, a drawstring backpack, Nike shoes, and an old pair of high school gym shorts that he hadn’t worn in a while because of how short they were. Sabrina also noticed that Ben had already begun to work up a sweat.

“Hey, have you been working out already?” she asked him.

“Yeah. I jogged here,” Ben answered.

“You never jog,” Sabrina said, beginning to put the pieces together.

“I know! But for some reason, it’s what I wanted to do. And I think I know why. It’s the remote,” Ben said quietly, patting the bag on his back.

“You think it worked,” Sabrina inferred.

“I do,” said Ben, “I think we switched personalities, and I think we should switch back.”

“Well... what if I don’t want a girly personality?” Sabrina asked.

“Are you saying you don’t want to go back to normal?”

“I’m saying that this could be the new normal. I feel so relaxed. I like it.”

“Sabrina, don’t be ridiculous. I’m going to fix this before it gets too weird.”

With that, Ben took the remote out of his bag, and aimed it at Sabrina.
